titles: Advertisement by the sheriff-deput of Aberdeen shire, undersubscryveing Whereas, by the foresaid proclamation, the Lords of their Majesties most honorable Privy Councill, doe strictly require and command obedience to the former proclamation and this, for setling of maintenance for the indigent and necessitous poor, and suppressing of vagabounds and sturdie beggers, ...
author: Fraser, Andrew, of Kinmundie.
publisher: Forbes]Printed at Edinburgh, and re-printed at Aberdeen by command of authority,
notes: At head of title: Printed at Edinburgh, and re-printed at Aberdeen by command of authority, anno Dom. 1693.
Signed and dated at end:  Given at Aberdeen the twentyseventh [sic] day of September, one thousand six hundred and nintie three years. By me Andrew Fraser.
Reproduction of the original in the Aberdeen City Charter Room.
